meanings.definition: To dig up (a body) from the ground.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist exhumes ancient artifacts carefully.
meanings.sent2: The gravedigger exhumes the coffin for examination.
meanings.sent3: The curious dog exhumes buried bones in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The storm exhumes long-buried secrets of the town.
meanings.sent5: The gardener exhumes the bulbs to replant them in the spring.

meanings.definition: To bring to light, uncover, reveal.
meanings.sent1: The journalist exhumes the truth behind the scandal.
meanings.sent2: The detective exhumes new evidence in the case.
meanings.sent3: The comedian exhumes hilarious memories from childhood.
meanings.sent4: The artist exhumes emotions through their paintings.
meanings.sent5: The researcher exhumes forgotten stories from the archives.
